io.github.gotonode.compress.io

Class BinaryReadTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.gotonode.compress.io.BinaryReadTool

  • public class BinaryReadTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This binary reading tool is used by both Huffman and LZW to read in bytes from the stream (the file).

    Helper methods have been created to read the specified amount of data at once (1 bit, 32 bits, 1 byte etc).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryReadTool(java.io.File file)
      Instantiates this object.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close() 
      boolean readBool()
      Reads a boolean value (a single bit, either 0 or 1).
      char readChar()
      Reads an 8-bit character from the stream.
      int readCodeword()
      Reads a codeword of the specified length (12-bit) from the stream.
      java.lang.String readData()
      Simply reads everything from the stream, beginning from the current position.
      int readInt()
      Reads an integer (32 bit) from the stream.
      void reset()
      Starts from the beginning, and resets the streams.
      boolean streamHasData()
      Checks if the stream still has data available for us.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts from the beginning, and resets the streams.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On IO error.

      • readBool

        public boolean readBool()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a boolean value (a single bit, either 0 or 1).
        Returns:
        The boolean, representing the bit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't read from the stream.

      • readChar

        public char readChar()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an 8-bit character from the stream.
        Returns:
        The next 8-bit character from the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't read from the stream.

      • readInt

        public int readInt()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an integer (32 bit) from the stream.
        Returns:
        The next integer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't read from the stream.

      • readCodeword

        public int readCodeword()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a codeword of the specified length (12-bit) from the stream.

        Used by LZW, and not used by Huffman.

        Returns:
        The codeword as an integer (this is a representation).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't read from the stream.

      • readData

        public java.lang.String readData()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Simply reads everything from the stream, beginning from the current position.
        Returns:
        A String containing all of the read data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't read from the stream.

      • streamHasData

        public boolean streamHasData()
        Checks if the stream still has data available for us.
        Returns:
        True if there's bytes to be read; false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
